Reviews.Title: “Hotel in an excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Pads07
Reviews.Content: Just returned from long weekend in this hotel. From the reviews I was feeling a bit wary. Yes the lift is very small, the rooms bit dated. On the plus side staff were polite and helpful, good choice for breakfast. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable and you could open the windows. There was always plenty of hot water and the location was superb for getting to the sights. This hotel provides everything you need ( albeit basic in some people's eyes ) to see Paris easily and comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tarah_Nathan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very small indeed, and the hallways and the lift are narrow, but to my nice surprise, the room was clean, there was a big comfortable bed, the bathroom was up to standard, too (big and clean, with all amenities included). Yes, the furniture and the carpet aren't exactly up to the latest fashion trends, but c'mon -if you are searching for luxury,why don't you go straight to the Hilton?? I would definitely stay there again,although two years ago the prices were much lower than what I'm seeing now.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to standards”
Reviews.Author: cbpils
Reviews.Content: We, a family of two adults, two teenagers and two children, stayed at this hotel for four nights. We arrived very late, due to flightcomplications and we didn't exactly get what we expected. Instead of a room with 3 beds, we got a SMALL, very hot room with one small bed and mildew on the ceiling. The staffmember said that I had only booked a room for one person, not three persons and showed something on his computer that I didn't quite get since it was in french. When I came home I checked my onlinereservation and it clearly stated that I had ordered a room for 3 people. He acctually expected that we stayed in that horrible room for the night. Good luck fitting two adults and a child in a 120 cm bed. Finally we got an additionalroom after some quarrelling. One big minus was the lack of minibars or eve a vending machine in the hotel. We were deadthirsty when we arrived. The staffmember gave us a bottle of water for free, thanks for that.. The rooms were shabby and not at all like the pictures but clean (enough). The elevator deserves a chapter of it's own. Never saw a smaller elevator and the halls were very narrow two. I'm certain that the safety on this hotel is not up to date! Location, location, location.. What can I say, this hotel is almost perfectly located and is the only reason to why one should pick this hotel! We had a room on the top floor and could acctually see the sacre cour cathedral from the window. Staff was helpful, except from one guy, the one who wanted us to stay in the small, creepy room. I understand that the hotelstandard in Paris is poor but this is NOT a 3* hotel! We stayed in an acctual 3* hotel in Norway on our way to Paris and that hotel was a palace compared to hotel ce chateaudune..

Reviews.Title: “Average with one big plus!”
Reviews.Author: Gmuzza
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of days on my own whilst on some personal business. I found the rooms adequate but nothing special. It was clean and bedding was changed daily with nice crisp bed linen. It is situated on a fairly busy road so if you are the front then you need to keep the double glazing closed for sound insulation. ONE BIG PLUS... when I left Paris I actually left my laptop in the room... I only realised on the train to Amsterdam so I called them immediately. They found my laptop and posted it back to me within a few days for no charge! The hotel may be average but I can 100% vouch for the honesty of the staff. Many thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: bleem
Reviews.Content: bad : - lift too small not even enough for 2 ppl + 2 luggages - corridor is too small for an adult and luggages - breakfast is horrible only few choice, service of the breakfast lady is bad.. impolite & not helpful - breakfast serving hour from 7-10 am , the lady start closing the breakfast area from 9 am . what the hack! - always forget to clean up the room - right on top of metro . i was living at 1st floor and you could hear every single train pass by in the room. good : - very convenient (metro exit just outside the hotel !) - overall is clean - only the white lady has good manner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TouristUser1351
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for Bastille Day with my father and we stayed in this hotel.It is very central and all the main tourist sites (Champs Elysees,Concorde,Louvre)bar the Eiffel Tower were easily accessible via metro.The staff were very nice and helpful.The hotels corridors were kind of tight but the rooms were very clean and what prompted me to write this review was other guests claiming that the hotel is dirty.I completely disagree with these claims as my stay was a pleasant one.My only complaints would be that my balcony was littered with cigarettes and that you could hear the guests in the other rooms although I have had the same problem in a four star hotel in Ireland so its not an unusual fault.If I was to stay in Paris again I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “super!!!”
Reviews.Author: hovoLondon
Reviews.Content: me and my fiancee spent the valentines day in Paris, after some searches we choosed this hotel for our 5 days vacation, because it's location is almost perfect for tourists, Monmartre, Opera and gallery lafayette are just few steps from the hotel.. and arriving to there we were very glad finding that we've done the right choce.. The room was clean and bathroom big personals (without exception) were so kind and always ready to help. i recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Traveltales13
Reviews.Content: The reviews touting this hotel as a 3-star were completely misleading. We arrived to the room smelling like stale cigarettes, with the window wide open (it was -10 degrees), a dirty bathroom, uncomfortable thin sheets and horrible air ventilation. The hotel is like a boutique hostel, not hotel. This hotel is cheap (and not cheap enough) for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy hovel”
Reviews.Author: CCoupe
Reviews.Content: What a filthy little hole this is! The whole hotel stunk, it was damp and musty, the rooms were just about big enough to fit the 20 year old beds in, the bathroom was covered top to bottom in black mildew. Also lost my appetite as I watched mice running freely around the restaurant, with the staff looking on as if that was perfectly normal. Have demanded a full refund and apology.

Reviews.Title: “not too bad”
Reviews.Author: sbs74
Reviews.Content: Not the neighborhood I'd have picked -- but it was available and within budget. The room was very small, the front desk was helpful and while we were not centrally located, we did manage to get aorund easily. Also, there is something to be said for being a bit off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “Needed a good scrubbing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 1st anniversary. The room was comfortable and well appointed but the grout in the shower/tub was growing its own lab experiment - mold on the ceiling tile as well. The lobby staff were tolerant at best and the cleaning staff were beyond rude. God forbid you want to sleep past 8am. We even had one cleaning employee barge in without knocking. The road noise was constant and you know when your neighbors are settling in for the evening. My advise - spend the extra coin on a 4-star. I've never had any trouble at the Le Meridien Etoile. Highlights of the trip: Moulin Rouge show, AirConnections shuttle service, and the Tourist Pass for the Metro (minimizes the blisters). Happy Trails!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel at pret a porter prices!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Referred to this hotel via an ad on a newspaper website - we were surprised at the location - but delighted at the rooms and service. The bespoke furnishings are beautiful and the fact that the rooms have air con made a budget break into an absolute treat. The staff are very helpful - and tolerant of my dreadful French! It is a short walk to the Grands Magasins but don't forget to look at the smaller shops too - and the fantastic local bistros.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de Chateaudun
HotelInfo.Address: 30 rue de Chateaudun, 75009 Paris, France
